course.title: God, Justice, and the Book of Job
course.meeting_text: M., W., (F.), at 12, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.faculty_text: Peter Machinist (Near Eastern Languages and Civilizations)
course.description: An examination of the biblical book of Job along with related texts, ancient, medieval, and modern, that allow us to establish the literary and philosophical traditions in which Job was composed and the literary and philosophical legacy it has left. Particular focus on the ways the texts play off one another in literary form and expression and in their treatment of such themes as divine justice, human piety, and the nature of the divine-human encounter.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
